name: Danielle A. Jackson
bio: Danielle A. Jackson grew up in Memphis and now lives in Brooklyn. Her essays have appeared in Shondaland, the New Yorker, Literary Hub, and Vela. She is a contributor at Memoir Magazine and has been awarded fellowships and residencies from Aspen Words, Sula's Room/Hedgebrook, and VONA. She is working on a memoir about her grandmother's move from Clarksdale to Memphis during the Great Flood of 1927.
